titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Blacksburg Vertical Files (List of Subjects), 1960s-present
titlestmt.subtitle: Blacksburg Vertical Files (List of Subjects) VerticalFile.001

titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
Special Collections VerticalFile.001

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Blacksburg Vertical Files must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: [Item-specific information], Blacksburg Vertical File, Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Newman Library staff began collection materials for vertical files during the 1960s. Special Collections staff add to existing files and continue to create new files as the need arises.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: In general, vertical files at Special Collections include newspaper clippings, photocopies, ephemera, unpublished and/or informal publications, and other papers relating to a specific subject area. Files in this collection relate to Blacksburg and its history. Each topic below has at least one folder and many include cross references.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Vertical files are arranged alphabetically by subject.

list.item: Biographical Vertical Files (mostly relating to Virginia Tech and/or local history)
Record Group Vertical Files (history of Virginia Tech colleges, departments, administrative units, and organizations)
Virginia Tech and Local History Mounted Clippings (precursor to the vertical files, with materials dating back to the 1870s)
